description: How stars are born, live, and die in spectacular fashion.

slides.title: What is a Star?
slides.content:
# Cosmic Fusion Reactors ‚òÄÔ∏è

A luminous spheroid of plasma held together by its own gravity.
- Powered by **Nuclear Fusion** in the core.
- The Sun is an average star.

slides.title: Star Formation
slides.content:
# A Star is Born üë∂

Born in **Nebulae** (clouds of dust and Hydrogen).
1. Gravity pulls dust together.
2. Protostar heats up.
3. Temperature reaches 10 million K.
4. Fusion ignites! ($H + H \to He + Energy$).

slides.title: Hydrostatic Equilibrium
slides.content:
# The Balancing Act ‚öñÔ∏è

A star is a battleground:
- **Gravity** trying to crush it inward.
- **Fusion Pressure** pushing outward.

While they balance, the star is stable (Main Sequence).

slides.title: The H-R Diagram
slides.content:
# The Map of Stars üó∫Ô∏è

Hertzsprung-Russell Diagram plots stars by:
- **Temperature** (X-axis, Hot Left $\to$ Cool Right).
- **Luminosity** (Y-axis, Bright Top $\to$ Dim Bottom).

90% of stars are on the **Main Sequence** diagonal.

slides.title: Stability Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What force balances gravity to keep a star stable?

slides.title: Spectral Classification
slides.content:
# OBAFGKM üåà

Stars classified by temperature (color).
- **O**: Blue, Hottest.
- **B**: Blue-White.
- **A**: White.
- **F**: Yellow-White.
- **G**: Yellow (Sun).
- **K**: Orange.
- **M**: Red, Coolest. (Most common).

slides.title: Low Mass Star Death
slides.content:
# Gentle End üïØÔ∏è

(Like our Sun)
1. Runs out of Hydrogen.
2. Swells into a **Red Giant** (fusing Helium).
3. Puffs off outer layers (**Planetary Nebula**).
4. Core remains as a **White Dwarf**.

slides.title: High Mass Star Death
slides.content:
# Violent End üí•

1. Fuses heavy elements up to **Iron**.
2. Iron absorbs energy, fusion stops.
3. Core collapses in milliseconds.
4. **Supernova** explosion!

slides.title: Neutron Stars
slides.content:
# Dense üß∂

Remnant of a supernova (if $1.4 < Mass < 3$ Suns).
- Protons + Electrons crushed into Neutrons.
- Size of a city, mass of a sun.
- **Pulsars**: Rapidly spinning neutron stars.

slides.title: Black Holes
slides.content:
# The Abyss üï≥Ô∏è

Remnant of a massive supernova (if $Mass > 3$ Suns).
- Gravity is so strong not even light can escape.
- **Event Horizon**: The point of no return.
- **Singularity**: Infinite density at center.

slides.title: Nucleosynthesis
slides.content:
# Star Stuff ‚ú®

Big Bang made H and He.
**Stars** made everything else.
- Fusion makes C, N, O.
- Supernovae make Gold, Silver, Uranium.

Every atom in your body was cooked in a star.

slides.title: Death Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What will our Sun eventually become?

slides.title: Binary Stars
slides.content:
# Two Suns üëØ

Most stars are in binary/multiple systems.
- **Visual**: Seen through telescope.
- **Eclipsing**: One passes in front of other (Luminosity dip).
- **Spectroscopic**: Doppler shift reveals motion.

slides.title: Variable Stars
slides.content:
# Winking Stars üí°

Stars that change brightness.
- **Cepheid Variables**: Pulsate like a beating heart. Period is related to luminosity. Used as "Standard Candles" to measure distance.

slides.title: Stellar Clusters
slides.content:
# Star Cities üèôÔ∏è

- **Open Clusters**: Young, loose group (Pleiades).
- **Globular Clusters**: Old, dense ball of millions of stars. Orbit galaxy center.

slides.title: Brown Dwarfs
slides.content:
# Failed Stars üìâ

Too big to be a planet, too small to fuse Hydrogen.
- Glow dimly in Infrared.
- The "missing link" between Gas Giants and Stars.

slides.title: Stellar Evolution
slides.content:
# Timescales ‚è±Ô∏è

- Massive stars live fast and die young (Millions of years).
- Small Red Dwarfs live nearly forever (Trillions of years).
- Mass determines density.

slides.title: Nova vs Supernova
slides.content:
# Boom vs KA-BOOM üß®

- **Nova**: White dwarf steals gas from neighbor -> Surface explosion. Star survives.
- **Supernova**: Total destruction of the star.

slides.title: Stellar Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- Mass is destiny.
- **H-R Diagram** tracks life stages.
- Through fusion and explosion, stars enrich the universe with elements for life.
